Russian (RU): "Единственная выжившая на Роккенджиме. А также ведьма будущего, Золотая и Бесконечная ведьма с 1986 по 1998 годы!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou a única sobrevivente de Rokkenjima. Também chamada de Bruxa Dourada do Infinito do futuro, entre 1986 até 1998!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我是六軒島唯一的生還者。並且，還是從 1986 年到 1998 年繼承黃金和無限的魔女之名的，未來的魔女！！」

Speaker: {f:5:Eva Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "In the world of the future, Battler‐kun, your sappy illusion is more fragile than a flake of snow on a lake! Okay, let's have some fun!! Come, try to remember, {i:all of you}... Remember your endless theory‐making!!"
Steam (ST): In the world of the future, Battler-kun's sentimental illusion is more fragile than a flake of snow on a lake! Okay, let's have some fun!! Come, try to remember, "all of you". Remember "your" endless theory-making!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the world of the future, Battler-kun's sentimental illusion is more fragile than a flake of snow on a lake! Okay, let's have some fun!! Come, try to remember, 'all of you'. Remember 'your' endless theory-making!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人くんの甘ったるゥい幻想なんて、未来の世界では湖面に落ちる一粒の雪より儚いわッ。さぁ、楽しんでちょうだい！！　さぁさ、思い出して御覧なさい、“あなたたち”の無限の推理を！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「戦人くんの甘ったるゥい幻想なんて、未来の世界では湖面に落ちる一粒の雪より儚いわッ。さぁ、楽しんでちょうだい！！　さぁさ、思い出して御覧なさい、“あなたたち”の無限の推理を！！」
Russian (RU): "В мире будущего сентиментальная иллюзия Баттлера ещё более хрупкая, чем хлопья снега на озере! Что ж, давайте повеселимся! Ну же, вспомните, {i:все вы}. Вспомните свои бесчисленные теории!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No mundo do futuro, Battler‐kun, essa sua ilusão viçosa é mais frágil que um floco de neve no lago! Certo, vamos animar as coisas!! Vamos, busquem recordar, {i:todos vocês}... Recordem suas infinitas teorias!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「戰人君的天真幻想什麼的，比未來世界中落在湖面上的一朵雪花還要虛幻。來，讓我歡樂一下吧！！來來，想起來吧，“你們”的無限的推理！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「战人君的天真幻想什么的，比未来世界中落在湖面上的一朵雪花还要虚幻。来，让我欢乐一下吧！！来来，想起来吧，“你们”的无限的推理！！」

Umineko Project (UP): When {f:5:Eva} held her hand to the heavens, light gathered there and took the form of a bottle.
Steam (ST): When {f:5:Eva} held her hand to the heavens, light gathered there and took the form of a bottle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When EVA held her hand to the heavens, light gathered there and took the form of a bottle.
PC Japanese (JP): エヴァが右手を天にかざすと、そこに光が集まり、ボトルの形となる。
Russian (RU): Когда ведьма {f:5:Ева} протянула руку к небесам, там собрался свет и принял форму бутылки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando {f:5:Eva} ergueu suas mãos na direção do céu, uma luz ali se reuniu e assumiu a forma de uma garrafa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏娃的右手向天一指，那裡的光聚集成了瓶子的形狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏娃的右手向天一指，那里的光聚集成了瓶子的形状。

Umineko Project (UP): Yes, a bottle. A glass bottle with no label.
Steam (ST): Yes, a bottle. A glass bottle with no label.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Yes, a bottle. A glass bottle with no label.
PC Japanese (JP): そう、ボトル。それはラベルのないガラス瓶に見えた。
Russian (RU): Да, бутылки. Стеклянной бутылки без этикетки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, uma garrafa. Uma garrafa de vidro sem nenhum rótulo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，瓶子。那是沒有貼上標籤的玻璃瓶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，瓶子。那是没有贴上标签的玻璃瓶。

Umineko Project (UP): There was no alcohol inside. ......Sealed within it was a fragment that let off a pale, sinister light.
Steam (ST): There was no alcohol inside. ...Sealed within it was a Fragment that let off a pale, sinister light.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was no alcohol inside. ......Sealed within it was a Fragment that let off a pale, sinister light.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não havia álcool dentro. ......Selado dentro dela estava um Fragmento que emitia uma sinistra luz pálida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 裡面不是酒。……而是封著奇怪的青白色光芒的碎片。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 里面不是酒。……而是封着奇怪的青白色光芒的碎片。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「战、战人！！这可糟了！！不能让它碎掉！！」

Umineko Project (UP): At that moment, they heard a tremendous hiss.{n}It was as though large chunks of hail had started falling everywhere.
Steam (ST): At that moment, they heard a thundering roar. It was as though large chunks of hail had started falling everywhere.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that moment, they heard a thundering roar. It was as though large chunks of hail had started falling everywhere.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、激しい音が、ざあっと聞こえた。まるで、大きな雹が一斉に降ってきたような音だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その時、激しい音が、ざあっと聞こえた。{n}まるで、大きな雹が一斉に降ってきたような音だった。
Russian (RU): В этот момент они услышали оглушительный рёв.{n}Как будто повсюду начал падать крупный град.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, eles ouviram um forte silvo.{n}Como se grandes pedaços de granizo tivessem começado a cair em uníssono por toda parte.

Steam (ST): An earthquake accompanied that noise, and the whole mansion creaked. Dust began to fall from the ceiling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An earthquake accompanied that noise, and the whole mansion creaked. Dust began to fall from the ceiling.
PC Japanese (JP): その音は地響きさえ伴い、屋敷全体を軋ませた。天井の埃がぱらぱらと落ちる。
Russian (RU): За этим шумом последовало землетрясение, и весь особняк скрипнул. С потолка посыпалась пыль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com um terremoto acompanhado do ruído, toda a mansão gemeu. Poeira começou a cair do teto.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这声音甚至伴随着大地轰响，辗压着大屋整体。灰尘从天花板上哗啦哗啦落下来。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 与此同时，关着窗帘的窗外，似乎也闪了青白色的光。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「开、……开什么玩笑…。……这就是，我们的真实…！不许肆意用未来的，而且是无关的人所期待的真实给改写…！」

Steam (ST): This repulsive scene stole the words from everyone's lips...

Steam (ST): No point in letting them know...that there was plenty of prey waiting in this bright, warm room, ...prey that was softer and easier to chew than roses or bricks...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No point in letting them know......that there was plenty of prey waiting in this bright, warm room, ......prey that was softer and easier to chew than roses or bricks......
PC Japanese (JP): この明るく温かい部屋の中に、……薔薇やレンガよりも柔らかくて食べ応えのある獲物が、大勢いることを……。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não fazia sentido deixar elas saberem que......ainda havia muitas presas esperando neste brilhante e caloroso cômodo, ......presas muito mais suculentas e satisfatórias do que mastigar rosas ou tijolos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為這明亮溫暖的房間中，……比玫瑰和磚瓦要柔軟的可以吃的獵物，有著一大堆……。

Umineko Project (UP): There was already a huge swarm of them in the garden, so it was no surprise that, when one of them looked around for new prey, it would see the light from this window.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 浮在狂乱的大海上的夏娃，向着天空这样一喊，……青白色光芒的冰雹，就哗啦哗啦地落下来。

Umineko Project (UP): Each one was a bottle with no label and a fragment inside.
Steam (ST): Each was an unlabelled bottle with a Fragment inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Each one was a bottle with no label and a Fragment inside.
PC Japanese (JP): それは全て、カケラを詰めたラベルのないボトル。
Russian (RU): Бутылки с фрагментами без этикетки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada uma das garrafas sem rótulo continha um Fragmento dentro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這些全都是，塞滿碎片的無標籤玻璃瓶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这些全都是，塞满碎片的无标签玻璃瓶。

Umineko Project (UP): They poured onto the island, smashing into bits and scattering the fragments inside them everywhere.
Steam (ST): They poured onto the island, were smashed to bits, and the Fragments inside them scattered everywhere.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They poured onto the island, were smashed to bits, and the Fragments inside them scattered everywhere.
PC Japanese (JP): それらが島に降り注ぎ、粉々に割れては、中身のカケラを撒き散らす。
Russian (RU): Они обрушились на остров, вдребезги разбились, и повсюду рассыпались фрагменты, которые были внутри.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas choveram sobre a ilha, se quebrando em pedaços e espalhando os Fragmentos que estavam dentro delas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它們掉落在島上，摔得粉碎，裡面的碎片也散落一地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它们掉落在岛上，摔得粉碎，里面的碎片也散落一地。

Umineko Project (UP): Every now and then, one of those fragments would split in two, then split in two again, and every single one of those fragments burst and gave birth to a massive goat.
Steam (ST): Every now and then, the Fragments would split in two, then split in two again, and every single one of them burst and gave birth to a massive goat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Every now and then, the Fragments would split in two, then split in two again, and every single one of them burst and gave birth to a massive goat.
PC Japanese (JP): そのカケラは時に２つに割れ、さらに２つに割れ、それら一つ一つが全て割れて、山羊の巨体を生み出していく。
Russian (RU): Время от времени фрагменты разделялись надвое, а затем снова на две части, и каждая из них трескалась, порождая массивного козлоголового.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De tempos em tempos, um desses Fragmentos se dividia em dois, dividindo‐se em dois novamente, e cada um desses Fragmentos explodia, dando à luz a uma nova cabra gigante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這些碎片有時分為兩半，再分成兩半，一個一個全都裂開，產生出擁有巨大身軀的山羊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这些碎片有时分为两半，再分成两半，一个一个全都裂开，产生出拥有巨大身躯的山羊。

Umineko Project (UP): To say it was like bamboo shoots springing up after the rain would be a vast understatement.
Steam (ST): To say it was like bamboo shoots springing up after the rain would be a vast understatement.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To say it was like bamboo shoots springing up after the rain would be a vast understatement.
PC Japanese (JP): 雨後のタケノコのように、という表現すら、もはや適当ではない。
Russian (RU): Сказать, что это напоминало вырастающие после дождя бамбуковые побеги, значит ничего не сказать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dizer que eram brotos de bambu brotando após a chuva seria um entendimento válido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就連如雨後春筍一般這樣的比喻，都已經不恰當了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就连如雨后春笋一般这样的比喻，都已经不恰当了。

Umineko Project (UP): The goats writhed about like bubbling, boiling water in a pot.
Steam (ST): The goats writhed about like bubbling, boiling water in a pot.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The goats writhed about like bubbling, boiling water in a pot.
PC Japanese (JP): 煮立った鍋の水面がごぼごぼと泡で煮立つかのように、山羊たちが湧き出してくるのだ。
Russian (RU): Козлорогие корчились как булькающая, кипящая вода в кастрюле.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As cabras se contorciam como se estivessem borbulhando, fervendo em uma panela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像是煮東西的鍋裡水面上噗啦啦冒出氣泡一樣，山羊們涌現出來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像是煮东西的锅里水面上噗啦啦冒出气泡一样，山羊们涌现出来。

Umineko Project (UP): They ate away at everything they saw.
Steam (ST): They ate away at everything they saw.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They ate away at everything they saw.
PC Japanese (JP): そして目に付くあらゆるものを食い尽くしていく。
Russian (RU): Они пожирали всё, что видели.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas comiam tudo o que viam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將映在眼睛中的所有東西吞食殆盡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将映在眼睛中的所有东西吞食殆尽。

Umineko Project (UP): They didn't just eat the harbor, but the trees and rocks, the entire coastline itself. Hundreds, thousands, ...no, tens of thousands of goats continued to eat...
Steam (ST): They didn't just eat the harbor, but the trees and rocks, the entire coastline itself. Hundreds, thousands, ...no, tens of thousands of goats continued to eat...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They didn't just eat the harbor, but the trees and rocks, the entire coastline itself. Hundreds, thousands, ...no, tens of thousands of goats continued to eat...
PC Japanese (JP): 船着場はおろか、木や石、海岸線そのものさえ。何百何千、いや何万という山羊たちがガツガツと食い尽くしていく…。
Russian (RU): Не только гавань, но и деревья, камни, саму береговую линию. Сотни, тысячи... нет, десятки тысяч козлоголовых продолжали есть...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas não comeram só o atracadouro, mas as árvores, pedras e toda a costa em si. Centenas, milhares, ...não, dezenas de milhares de cabras continuavam a comer...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不用說碼頭了，木頭和石塊，就連海岸線本身。都被上百上千，不，甚至上萬的山羊們啃食一空…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不用说码头了，木头和石块，就连海岸线本身。都被上百上千，不，甚至上万的山羊们啃食一空…。

Umineko Project (UP): They were chewing away at every bit of Rokkenjima, ......of this final game that Battler had prepared......
Steam (ST): They were chewing away at every bit of Rokkenjima, ...of this final game that Battler had prepared...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were chewing away at every bit of Rokkenjima, ......of this final game that Battler had prepared......
PC Japanese (JP): 六軒島の全てを、……戦人の用意したこの最後のゲームを、全て全て喰らい尽くしていく……。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas estavam mastigando cada pedaço de Rokkenjima, ......deste último jogo preparado por Battler......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將六軒島的全部，……戰人所準備的這最後的遊戲，一切一切吃個乾淨……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将六轩岛的全部，……战人所准备的这最后的游戏，一切一切吃个干净……。

Speaker: {f:5:Eva Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Ahhahahhahahahahaha!! Too bad, Battler‐kun! The future wants a tragedy on this island...! Even Ange wants the truth! We'll just chew up all the ostentation, illusions, and fantasy for them!!"
Steam (ST): "Ahhahahhahahahahaha!! Too bad, Battler-kun! The future wants a tragedy on this island...! Even Ange wants the truth! Don't worry, we'll chew up all the embellishment, illusions, and fantasy for you!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Ahhahahhahahahahaha!! Too bad, Battler-kun! The future wants a tragedy on this island...! Even Ange wants the truth! We'll just chew up all the ostentation, illusions, and fantasy for them!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あっははっはっはっは！！　悪いわね、戦人くゥん！　未来はこの島に惨劇を望んでいるの…！　縁寿だって、真実を望んでる！　虚飾も幻想もまやかしも、全て全て喰らい尽くしてあげるわッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Аха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха! Какая жалость, Баттлер! Будущее хочет на этом острове трагедию!.. Даже Энджи желает правды! Мы просто прожуём для них все иллюзии, всю показную роскошь и фантастику!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ahhahahhahahahahaha!! Que pena, Battler‐kun! O futuro deseja por uma tragédia nesta ilha...! Até a Ange deseja a verdade! Vamos mastigar toda a ostentação, ficção e fantasia deles!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊哈哈哈哈哈！！抱歉啊，戰人君！未來可是期望著這座島的慘劇…！就算是緣壽，也渴望著真實！虛飾也好幻想也好虛假也好，全部全部都給你吃個光吧！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊哈哈哈哈哈！！抱歉啊，战人君！未来可是期望着这座岛的惨剧…！就算是缘寿，也渴望着真实！虚饰也好幻想也好虚假也好，全部全部都给你吃个光吧！！」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人他們已經不得不承認。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人他们已经不得不承认。

Umineko Project (UP): The future wanted a tragedy.{n}Even if the truth of this island had been a gentle, peaceful thing.{n}The future didn't want that.
Steam (ST): The future wanted a tragedy. Even if the truth of this island had been a gentle, peaceful thing... The future didn't want that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The future wanted a tragedy. Even if the truth of this island had been a gentle, peaceful thing. The future didn't want that.
PC Japanese (JP): 未来は、惨劇を望んでいる。仮にこの島の真実が、和やかで平和だったとしても。未来は、それを望んでいない。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 未来，在期待着惨剧。{n}假若这座岛的真实是平和安稳的。{n}未来也，不希望会这样。

Steam (ST): The truth they wanted...was painting over the past.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The truth they wanted...was painting over the past.

Russian (RU): Тела этих козлоголовых отличались от тех, которые только что так легко стали трупами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os corpos dessas cabras eram diferentes daquelas que se tornaram cadáveres pouco tempo atrás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊們的肉體，和之前輕鬆被砍翻的山羊們不同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊们的肉体，和之前轻松被砍翻的山羊们不同。

Umineko Project (UP): They had mystery‐style answers to several locked rooms.
Steam (ST): They had mystery-style answers to several closed rooms.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They had mystery-style answers to several closed rooms.
PC Japanese (JP): いくつもの密室にミステリーとしての答えを持つ。
Russian (RU): У них были ответы в стиле детектива на некоторые закрытые комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles tinham respostas num estilo mais misterioso para diversos quartos fechados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 擁有對數個密室的推理劇答案。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 拥有对数个密室的推理剧答案。

Umineko Project (UP): So, it would take several blade hits to deal them a fatal wound.
Steam (ST): So, it would take several blade hits to give them a fatal wound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, it would take several blade hits to give them a fatal wound.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、いくつもの刃を突き立てねば、致命傷が与えられない。
Russian (RU): Поэтому потребуется несколько ударов лезвием, чтобы нанести им смертельную рану.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, era necessário diversos golpes para causar uma ferida fatal nelas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，不多給它們幾刀，是無法造成致命傷的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，不多给它们几刀，是无法造成致命伤的。

Umineko Project (UP): However, Beato had left many blades behind. All of them were exceedingly sharp.
Steam (ST): However, Beato had left many blades behind. All of them were exceedingly sharp.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Beato had left many blades behind. All of them were exceedingly sharp.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ベアトの残した刃はいくつもある。何れも劣らぬ鋭さを持つ。
Russian (RU): Но Беато пережила многие лезвия, все из которых были чрезвычайно острыми.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, Beato tinha muitas lâminas em mãos. Todas eram extremamente afiadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，貝阿朵留下的刀刃還有幾個。每個都是相當的銳利。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，贝阿朵留下的刀刃还有几个。每个都是相当的锐利。

Umineko Project (UP): So, the pair of Inquisitors didn't think of this as a desperate battle.
Steam (ST): So, the pair of inquisitors didn't think this would be a desperate battle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, the pair of inquisitors didn't think this would be a desperate battle.
PC Japanese (JP): だからそれを、二人は苦戦とは思わない。
Russian (RU): Поэтому пара инквизиторов не думала, что битва будет отчаянной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Graças a elas, a dupla de Inquisidores não pensou nisso como uma batalha desesperadora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，這兩人還不覺得是苦戰。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，这两人还不觉得是苦战。

Umineko Project (UP): This was mystery.
Steam (ST): This is mystery.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This was mystery.
PC Japanese (JP): これが、ミステリー。
Russian (RU): Это был детектив.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso é o mistério.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這才是，推理劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这才是，推理剧。

Umineko Project (UP): The goal of a mystery is to use all your imagination and knowledge to challenge each of its riddles head on.
Steam (ST): The goal is to use all your imagination and knowledge to challenge each of the riddles head on.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The goal is to use all your imagination and knowledge to challenge each of the riddles head on.
PC Japanese (JP): それぞれの謎に、持てる知識と想像力の限りを尽くし、徹底的にぶつかり合う。
Russian (RU): Цель — использовать всё воображение и знание, чтобы бросить вызов каждой загадке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O objetivo de um mistério é usar toda a sua imaginação e conhecimento para desafiar cada um dos mistérios propostos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對各種謎團，利用自己擁有的知識發揮一切想像力，徹底地交手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对各种谜团，利用自己拥有的知识发挥一切想象力，彻底地交手。

Umineko Project (UP): Doing this is the greatest enjoyment of the mystery genre.
Steam (ST): Doing so is the greatest pleasure of the mystery genre.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Doing this is the greatest enjoyment of the mystery genre.
PC Japanese (JP): その過程こそがミステリーの最大の楽しみなのだ。
Russian (RU): Величайшее удовольствие детективного жанра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Fazer isso é a melhor forma de se apreciar o gênero.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個過程才是推理劇的最大的樂趣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个过程才是推理剧的最大的乐趣。

Umineko Project (UP): So they laughed. Both Will and Dlanor laughed.
Steam (ST): So they laughed. Both Will and Dlanor laughed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So they laughed. Both Will and Dlanor laughed.
PC Japanese (JP): だから笑う。ウィルもドラノールも笑う。
Russian (RU): Поэтому они засмеялись. И Уилл, и Дланор засмеялись.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim eles riram. Tanto Will quanto Dlanor riram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以會笑。威爾和德拉諾爾也會笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以会笑。威尔和德拉诺尔也会笑。

Umineko Project (UP): With smiles of admiration at the theories the goats had put everything they had into, they countered with blades from all the locked rooms.
Steam (ST): With smiles of admiration at the theories the goats had put everything they had into, they countered with blades from all the closed rooms.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With smiles of admiration at the theories the goats had put everything they had into, they countered with blades from all the closed rooms.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らの渾身の推理に感嘆の笑みを浮かべて、あらゆる密室の刃で反撃する。
Russian (RU): Восхищённо улыбаясь теориям, в которые козлоголовые вложили всё возможное, они ударили в ответ лезвиями всех закрытых комнат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com sorrisos de admiração diante das teorias que as cabras se empenharam para elaborar, eles contra‐atacaram com lâminas de todos os quartos fechados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 浮現出對它們全力的推理的感嘆的笑，並用各種密室的刀刃來反擊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 浮现出对它们全力的推理的感叹的笑，并用各种密室的刀刃来反击。

Umineko Project (UP): The crowd of goats was no longer an encirclement, but a great wave threatening to swallow the pair up.
Steam (ST): The crowd of goats was no longer an encirclement, but a great wave threatening to swallow the pair up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The crowd of goats was no longer an encirclement, but a great wave threatening to swallow the pair up.
PC Japanese (JP): 山羊の群たちはもはや包囲ではなく、津波のように二人を飲み込もうとする。
Russian (RU): Толпа козлоголовых уже была не окружением, а громадной волной, угрожающей поглотить их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A multidão de cabras já não formava mais um círculo, mas uma grande onda que ameaçava engolir a dupla.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊群們已經不是包圍了，而是像大浪一樣要將兩人吞噬。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊群们已经不是包围了，而是像大浪一样要将两人吞噬。

Umineko Project (UP): And yet, the pair repelled the enemy without giving an inch.
Steam (ST): And yet, the pair repelled the enemy without giving an inch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And yet, the pair repelled the enemy without giving an inch.
PC Japanese (JP): それを、一歩も退かずに二人は撃退する。
Russian (RU): И всё равно они отражали врага, не отдавая ни дюйма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda assim, os dois repeliram os inimigos sem dar um centímetro a mais a eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，這兩人一步都不後退地將對手擊退。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，这两人一步都不后退地将对手击退。

Umineko Project (UP): They resisted firmly, cutting through the tsunami of wailing goats.
Steam (ST): They resisted firmly, cutting through the wave of wailing goats.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They resisted firmly, cutting through the wave of wailing goats.
PC Japanese (JP): 阿鼻叫喚の山羊たちの津波に、海を割るかのように徹底的に抗う。
Russian (RU): Они твёрдо сопротивлялись, рассекая волну вопящих козлоголовых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles resistiram com firmeza, cortando através da tsunami de cabras lamuriosas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 痛苦呻吟的山羊們的大浪，像是要將海分成兩半一樣徹底地抵抗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 痛苦呻吟的山羊们的大浪，像是要将海分成两半一样彻底地抵抗。

Umineko Project (UP): It was like an ice‐breaking ship knocking a path through a frozen sea.
Steam (ST): It was like an ice-breaking ship knocking a path through a frozen sea.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was like an ice breaking ship knocking a path through a frozen sea.
PC Japanese (JP): それはまるで、凍結した海を切り裂いて進む砕氷船のよう。
Russian (RU): Напоминало ледокол, пробивающийся сквозь замёрзшее море.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi como um navio quebra‐gelo abrindo seu caminho em um mar congelado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這仿佛是，要將凍結的大海撕裂前進的碎冰船一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这仿佛是，要将冻结的大海撕裂前进的碎冰船一样。

Umineko Project (UP): ‘......They entered the locked room through a hidden passage that no one else could use, and......’
Steam (ST): "...They entered the closed room through a hidden passage that no one else could use, and..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 『......They entered the closed room through a hidden passage that no one else could use, and......』
PC Japanese (JP): 『……誰にも使えない秘密の通路で、密室に入った……。』
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 『……誰にも使えない秘密の通路で、密室に入った……』
Russian (RU): {p:0:『}......В закрытую комнату вошли через скрытый проход, который больше никто не мог использовать, и......{p:0:』}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ‘......Entraram no quarto fechado através de uma passagem secreta que ninguém mais conseguiria usar e......’
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 『……用誰都沒有用過的秘密通道，進入密室……』
Chinese Simplified (CN): 『……用谁都没有用过的秘密通道，进入密室……』

Speaker: Dlanor
Umineko Project (UP): "Knox's 3rd! It is forbidden for hidden passages to {f:5:exist}!!"
Steam (ST): "Knox's 3rd, it is forbidden for hidden passages to {f:5:exist}!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Knox's 3rd, it is forbidden for hidden passages to EXIST!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ノックス第３条ッ、秘密の通路の存在を禁ズッ！！」
Russian (RU): "3‐й Нокс, скрытые проходы {f:5:недопустимы}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Knox 3º! É proibida a existência de passagens {f:5:secretas}!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「诺克斯第 3 条，禁止存在秘密通道！！」

Umineko Project (UP): ‘......After the hidden passage was used, it was welded shut and became unusable, so no hidden passages existed at the time of the inspection...’
Steam (ST): "...After the hidden passage was used, it was welded shut and became unusable, so no hidden passages existed at the time of the inspection..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 『......After the hidden passage was used, it was welded shut and became unusable, so no hidden passages existed at the time of the inspection...』

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 『……秘密の通路を使用後、溶接して使用不可能にしたため、検証時には秘密の通路は存在してなくて…』
Russian (RU): {p:0:『}......После того как скрытый проход был использован, его заварили, и он стал непригоден, поэтому на момент инспекции скрытых проходов не было...{p:0:』}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ‘......Após usar a passagem secreta, ela foi soldada e se tornou inutilizável, por isso nenhuma passagem secreta existia no momento da inspeção...’

Chinese Simplified (CN): 『……使用秘密通道后，由于焊接上导致不能再使用，检证时秘密通道就不存在了…』

Speaker: Dlanor
Umineko Project (UP): "Knox's 8th! It is forbidden for the case to be resolved with clues that are not {f:5:presented}!!"
Steam (ST): "Knox's 8th, it is forbidden for the case to be resolved with clues that are not {f:5:presented}!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Knox's 8th, it is forbidden for the case to be resolved with clues that are not PRESENTED!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ノックス第８条ッ、提示されない手掛りでの解決を禁ズッ！！」
Russian (RU): "8‐й Нокс, недопустимо раскрывать дело с помощью {f:5:непредставленных} улик!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Knox 8º!  É proibido que o caso seja resolvido com pistas não {f:5:apresentadas}!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「諾克斯第 8 條，禁止以未提供的線索解決案件！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「诺克斯第 8 条，禁止以未提供的线索解决案件！！」

Umineko Project (UP): ‘......These are all fake murders, and no one is actually dead...... So, all locked rooms were constructed by the so‐called victims......’
Steam (ST): "...These are all fake murders, so no one is actually dead... So, all closed rooms were constructed by the so-called victims..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 『......These are all fake murders, so no one is actually dead...... So, all closed rooms were constructed by the so-called victims......』
PC Japanese (JP): 『……これは全て狂言殺人で、誰も死亡していない……。だから密室は全て、自称犠牲者によって構築された……。』
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 『……これは全て狂言殺人で、誰も死亡していない……。だから密室は全て、自称犠牲者によって構築された……』
Russian (RU): {p:0:『}......Все убийства фальшивые, и никто на самом деле не умер...... Поэтому все закрытые комнаты были образованы так называемыми жертвами......{p:0:』}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ‘......Foram assassinatos falsos e ninguém estava realmente morto...... Assim, todos os quartos fechados foram construídos pelas supostas vítimas......’
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 『……這些全都是騙局殺人，誰都沒有死……。所以密室全都是，由自稱的犧牲者們構築起來的……』

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Russian (RU): Дланор на мгновение замешкалась.

Umineko Project (UP): After all, this clichéd and simple theory managed to get around both Beato's locked rooms and the Knox Decalogue.
Steam (ST): After all, this cliched and simple theory managed to get around both Beato's closed rooms and the Knox Commandments.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, this cliched and simple theory managed to get around both Beato's closed rooms and the Knox Commandments.
PC Japanese (JP): その陳腐で在り来たりな推理が、ベアトの密室もノックス十戒も、全てを潜り抜けたからだ。
Russian (RU): Ведь этой шаблонной и простой теории удалось обойти и закрытые комнаты Беато, и заповеди Нокса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, essa teoria simples e clichê conseguia contornar tanto os quartos fechados de Beato quanto o Decálogo de Knox.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這陳腐的毫不稀奇的推理，無論是貝阿朵的密室還是諾克斯十誡，都能夠通過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这陈腐的毫不稀奇的推理，无论是贝阿朵的密室还是诺克斯十诫，都能够通过。

Umineko Project (UP): Dlanor saw nothingness inside the goats' massive jaws......
Steam (ST): Dlanor saw nothingness inside the goats' massive jaws...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dlanor saw nothingness inside the goats' massive jaws......

Russian (RU): В огромных челюстях козлоголовых Дланор увидела небытие......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dlanor viu o nada dentro das imensas mandíbulas da cabra......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在山羊的大嘴中，德拉諾爾看到了虛無……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在山羊的大嘴中，德拉诺尔看到了虚无……。

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): "Van Dine's Rule #7. It is forbidden to have a crime without a corpse."
Steam (ST): "Van Dine's 7th. It is forbidden to have a crime without a corpse."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Van Dine's 7th. It is forbidden to have a crime without a corpse."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ヴァンダイン第７則。死体なき事件であることを禁ず。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ヴァンダイン第７則。死体なき事件であることを禁ず」
Russian (RU): "7‐й Ван Дайн. Преступление без трупа недопустимо."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "7ª Regra de Van Dine. É proibido ter um crime sem cadáver."

Umineko Project (UP): Surely, the jaws of that goat had closed over Dlanor's head.
Steam (ST): The goat's jaws seemed to close around Dlanor's head.

PC Japanese (JP): 山羊の大顎は、確かにドラノールの頭を飲み込んだはずだった。
Russian (RU): Пасть козлоголового явно закрылась над головой Дланор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente, as mandíbulas das cabras chegaram próximas da cabeça de Dlanor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊的大口，確實應該已經吞下了德拉諾爾的頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊的大口，确实应该已经吞下了德拉诺尔的头。

Umineko Project (UP): However, the upper and lower jaw were no longer connected, ......so the upper half slid off to the side.
Steam (ST): However, the upper and lower jaws were no longer connected, ...so the upper half merely slid off to the side.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the upper and lower jaw were no longer connected, ......so the upper half slid off to the side.

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): "Look like even the great Knox never forbade fake murders."
Steam (ST): "I guess even the great Knox forgot to forbid fake murders."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「大诺克斯也对骗局杀人束手无策吗？」

Umineko Project (UP): "There are many splendid mysteries besides {f:5:murder}."
Steam (ST): "There are many splendid mysteries besides {f:5:murder}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There are many splendid mysteries besides murder."

Steam (ST): The goats weren't about to back off and let the pair have a nice, long chat about the mystery genre.

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Mystery is like chivalry. You fight with the noble rules that you've created, with pride in the stance you've taken. ......Is it worth being a coward if it'll help you win? Does losing make the whole fight meaningless if you fought with everything you had? ......It isn't about winning and losing, ...it's about applauding the will to fight even in the most dire circumstances..."

Does losing make the whole fight meaningless if you fought with everything you had? ...This isn't about winning and losing, ...it's about applauding the will to fight, even in the most dire circumstances..."
